intro: Encholirium hoehneanum, commonly known as the Hoehne's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Encholirium hoehneanum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
